result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trent A. Varney

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:02 PM Defendant Trent A. Varney in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Trent A. Varney.  Curtis Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Information filed - Court verbally reviews charges/penalties as charged. Formal reading waived. Not guilty plea entered.  STC set for 12/13/22 at 1:00 pm.

1:13 PM Defendant Trent A. Varney in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Trent A. Varney.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court makes record in re. disqualification and right to refusal.  Atty Frank requests to defer recusal at this time and proceed with preliminary hearing.  Court does not want to proceed with prelim until the defendant is able to make a decision on recusal.  Atty Frank discusses with defendant; defendant wishes to waive right to recusal.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties in the amended complaint with the defendant.  Waiver of formal reading of the amended complaint.   State calls Dpt. R. Wotnoske as witness, sworn and testified.    Counsel provide arguments in re. bind over.  Court makes finding of probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:21 AM Defendant Trent A. Varney in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Trent A. Varney.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court makes record in re. recusal and gives options, but will give defendant time to decide if recusal will be requested.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant.   Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
for Leave to File Additional Motions

9:01 AM Defendant Trent A. Varney in court, in custody.  Attorney Eric J Pollex not in court.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court attempted to contact Atty Pollex via phone and email, no response.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow defendant to make contact with counsel.  Court makes disclosure in re recusal and requests defendant discuss disqualification with Atty Pollex prior to next hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:00 PM Defendant Trent A. Varney appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Eric J Pollex in court for Trent A. Varney.  Attorney Zachary P Leigh in court for State of Wisconsin. $750.00 cash bond set.  No contact with A.L.V. (dob 9/28/84) or the residence at 2399 Cty Rd A., Mineral Point WI.
